--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2021/0379 b) Date of Occurrence: 14/03/2024
c) Installation Details: Banshee Fast - AC-2747-401 at
Sector North Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Pneumatic b) Date Component 18/03/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: De-icing System d) Main Assembly: Station-1 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: De-icing System Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PN-1434-M7 h) Sl No.: SN-9626-250
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 18/08/2020 l) Date of Removal: 15/03/2024
Pg No: 60 Ln No: 27 Pg No: 98 Ln No: 15
m) Manufacturing Agency: Beta Flight Solutions n) Date, Month & Year March 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 3729 Hrs / 643 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Pneumatic starter motor overheat. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Software algorithm error in control logic implementation
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective De-icing System component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement condition-based monitoring system
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings.
Date: 04/04/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Eng. K.N. Iyer

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility.
Date: 05/04/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational usage reviewed. Component operated within prescribed limits. Concur with investigation outcome.
Date: 08/04/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 07/04/2024 Signature: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions.
Date: 13/04/2024 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
